website_summaries.verdict: This is a super affordable corded electric engraver for those who seek a steady supply of power while engraving multiple items.
pros: Variable speed motor, up to 7,200 strokes per minute
Letter, number, and shape templates included
cons: Handle grip is not ergonomically designed
Very strong vibrations make it difficult to get smooth results

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to have... especially for engraving valuables
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. I lost my eyeglasses, and someone suggested that I engrave my replacements. It worked well when I engraved my phone number on the eyeglasses plastic stem. Easy to control and comfortable fit in my hand. I plan to engrave several items with my driver's license or phone number, as the police recommend doing that in case valuable items are stolen. (Caution: If you plan to do this, do not engrave your Social Security number. Police cannot trace the item back to you. But they can find you if you engrave your phone number or driver's license number.)
customer_reviews.author: D. Maurillo

customer_reviews.title: Darn thing works !!
customer_reviews.text: I put this little bugger to work right out of the box and began engraving everything I could get my hands on. The only thing that stopped me was the stern voice of my wife ordering me to stop. Tool works good and is very easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson D.

customer_reviews.title: Hey, It's $9 and works just fine
customer_reviews.text: for such an inexpensive unit this one has some features. PROS: - Templates for numbers and letters to trace including template for symbols: stars moons circles etc. templates are clear so aligning is 'ok' - easy to grip, and you you insert the scribe pin via the provide hex wrench. - on/off switch and - unit fits well in hand. CONS: - NOISY, but whatever, it's not like you'll be in a library so go with it.
customer_reviews.author: SonomaRik

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all for the price
customer_reviews.text: The engraving tip is removable. I'm not sure why. I had my previous engraver for at least 20 years and the tip never got dull. The one weak point is the tip...you use an allen wrench to tighten it into the socket. I didn't get it tight enough with the first use and the tip SHOT out of the engraver!! Luckily I was doing it on my kitchen counter and the tip hit the wall and stayed on the counter. If it had landed on my carpet, I would never have found it (until my vacuum did). I like the adjustable speed, that's a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: JF, RRT

customer_reviews.title: I just have to say this product is AWESOME. I ordered it to replace my glass etcher
customer_reviews.text: This is my first written review EVER. I just have to say this product is AWESOME. I ordered it to replace my glass etcher, which was a tiny lightweight light-duty thing that I burned up in a couple of months. This engraver is very heavy duty, and though it is a little bigger and heavier than my previous one, it is in no way cumbersome. I ordered some DREMEL diamond-tip bits and they work perfectly. I am quite excited about using this, it is well-built and I believe it will last. Will update in a couple of months when I've done a million more glass etchings....
customer_reviews.author: Raindrop

customer_reviews.title: not for fine work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to engrave custom watch movements. Others had reviewed less powerful engravers as being insufficient. Perhaps those tools are what I need for this unit can easily engrave a watch movement, in fact it is too powerful on the lowest setting. This being said, I have no doubt it will satisfactorily engrave larger objects to your satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Rich

customer_reviews.title: On/Off switch broke after a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to engrave some tools. I used it for about an hour and the on/off switch stopped working. If you're handy with a soldering iron, it's an easy fix. Still not a bad engraver for the money.
customer_reviews.author: trebor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this to remove excessive material from around some fossils I found. Seems to work good for this so far.
customer_reviews.author: wade daniels

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a battery operated engraver. This one was a life saver. It has different speeds. The needle that come with it is pretty sharp and will cut through glass so it will be a good idea to purchase another set.
customer_reviews.author: Brimaria

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: replacing a 30 year old worn out Dremel engraver. this works better & easy to use. I wear over the ear sound suppresser as this new WEN is loud.
customer_reviews.author: skip town

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it for limited of things so far. However, it worked good for the times I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Grrrbear

customer_reviews.title: Where do I buy replacement tips..
customer_reviews.text: Received today, everything was in the box. I Tried it out and the bit broke soonest it touch the object. Ran at lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Mata

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Great engraver first the money. Easy to use no parts to put together
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works well for keys
customer_reviews.text: Loved the multiple settings. I use it to label keys so the lowest setting works best to write on the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Prescott W.

customer_reviews.title: Like it, but small
customer_reviews.text: Like it but it feels weird, like it's too small for my hand
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: The engraver arrived on time and undamaged. I would say it is pretty descent for the price. The only reason marked it down, the stencils that come with it have barely enough gap to get the engraver in and are awkward to use. Some people may say that is not a reason to mark down (trivial), but it may help other folks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to engrave like an assist with it but it works great for the price and definitely does work!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Garrity

customer_reviews.title: Very well built tool. Company with good reputation.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job quite well. Easy to handle, light weight, effective results. Well built tool for engraving stainless steel and aluminum. Haven't tried it on softer metals yet, but intuit that it will work just as well with copper, brass, bronze, and even sterling.
customer_reviews.author: DL Harmon

customer_reviews.title: works as intended. a MUST HAVE for anyone that ...
customer_reviews.text: works as intended. a MUST HAVE for anyone that owns hand tools or power tools or any tools in general. Keeps them from walking away. However theres no way to engrave your engraver unless you borrow your co-workers or but 2 engravers
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro R.

customer_reviews.title: Overall it is "okay"
customer_reviews.text: So, there was supposed to be a bit included but mine didn't have one. Luckily, I found some but they didn't fit quite right into it. This thing is definitely loud and requires a semi-steady hand. I do like that it has multiple settings for how deep to engrave. Overall it is "okay"
customer_reviews.author: KayDN

customer_reviews.title: Use it outside, kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great engraver and well worth the money. It is very loud, however, and that is why I only gave it a 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: vibrates all over the surface and barely makes a line~ a waste of money~
customer_reviews.text: does not work very well... i have a steady hand and skill.... but trying to engrave a key or wrench is a messy joke! vibrates all over the surface and barely makes a line~ a waste of money~
customer_reviews.author: outi harma

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and it is worth the price. Just takes practice and a steady hand. I recommend engraving a piece of scrap metal before you go in grave Ur desirable things. Xoxo

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day.
customer_reviews.text: Very very disappointed. Broke the very first day. Bought it for my husband and I was upset to learn about this after the window to return ended. But we did go for the cheapest option so you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty straight forward here
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward here. It engraved a lock that I needed. Haven't used it since, but I bought it for one task. It worked as needed and it's cool that it has an adjustment knob for more power. I'm terrible at engraving though :p
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to learn but it works well
customer_reviews.text: We used this to engrave our pots and pans which seemed to be "borrowed" often. It was a bit tricky to learn to use but it turned out well. We free handed our engraving instead of using the stencil
customer_reviews.author: Thay Kozen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: This item is a great value and works well. I engraved a heavy duty metal item and it came out really nice. For less than the cost of a professional job, I did my own engraving and now own an engraver. The quality is as good as your hand is steady. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Lomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars like a champ! BUT LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: works great yeah BUT YOU WILL NEED EAR PROTECTION, IT'S LOUD!

customer_reviews.title: Portable & a must have around shop tool
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use this engraver.Perfect for marking plastic and metal tools and items,I haven't used the stencil just yet but it is durable & has a nice font for someone looking to detail.

customer_reviews.title: Wood engraving
customer_reviews.text: Like this product very much and it’s very light weight
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great engraver! I used it on several materials and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great engraver! I used it on several materials and it worked as expected! You have to practice a bit on a junk piece of material to make sure you can handle the drill. Seems to be pretty well made too!
customer_reviews.author: Skyeye

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for engraving metals, plastic etc.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this engraver to etch identifying marks in some of my power tools. Works very well with the supplied tip on plastic as well as metal. The engraver is easy to control and "write" with. Con: the supplied templates do not work well with the supplied tip as the tip is too large to fit in the template markings.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap. Easy to use. Engraves. It works! Only downside is sometimes if you move too fast with it, you can see individual perforations. Workaround: go slower! Expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Benji Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Hard to do detail. Works on glass. I bought it for leather and it didn't work out. It wasn't expensive so I'm not out a lot of money
customer_reviews.author: Melanie G.

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: My lesson is to have a light touch and let the tool do the work. I use it to scribe my name on my mechanics tools and it does work pretty well

customer_reviews.title: Best unit available.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit. It buzzes but it engraves deeply on all of my tools. It's definitely better than several other units I have purchased.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, tip is very strong and still going after engraving about fifty kind of tool including screw drivers, pipe wrenches and so on.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job on 1095 carbon steel. I engrave swords with it no problem a little loud but that's power!

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and for the price

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: I started out engraving a steel tool and it was easy to do - even free hand
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected! I started out engraving a steel tool and it was easy to do - even free hand. Unless you need a professional-type engraver, this will serve all your around-the-house needs.

product_meta.title: WEN 21C Variable Speed Electric Engraver Kit with Stencils,Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueRemember when you could write on anything? With the WEN Electric Engraver Kit, you don’t have to stop at paper. The 13-watt motor and tungsten carbide tip etches on metal, glass, wood, ceramic, plastic and leather. The variable stroke adjustment allows for heavy or fine precise engraving, allowing for a truly customized and clean look. This purchase also includes letter, number and symbol stencils to make simple designs while engraving. And because it’s a WEN product, your purchase comes backed by a two-year warranty, a friendly customer service help line, and a nationwide network of skilled technicians. Remember when you could engrave wood, glass, metal and plastic? Remember WEN.
feature_bullets: Soft grip Neck for comfort and control

specifications.Included Components: WEN 21C Variable Speed Electric Engraver Kit with Stencils
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars323 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
